citation.article-title: Thalassobaculum salexigens sp. nov., a new member of the family Rhodospirillaceae from the NW Mediterranean Sea, and emended description of the genus Thalassobaculum
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Thalassobaculum Zhang et al. 2008
The description of the genus Thalassobaculum is as given by Zhang et al. (2008) with the following emendments.
Some of the strains are facultative anaerobes.
The major fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, C16 : 0, C17 : 0 and summed feature 3 (C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH).
The DNA G+C content is 65–68 mol%.
